abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Economic Governance Technical
            Assistance Project will further assist the Government of
            Haiti in strengthening its institutional capacity in the
            areas of public sector resource management and improved
            responsiveness to citizen needs and demands. The project
            consist of the following components: component 1: Financial
            Resource Management aims at the development of a capacity to
            produce and execute a budget, track its implementation, and
            reduce irregular uses and expenditures. Component 2: Human
            Resource Development of an initial plan for meeting the
            public administration's most critical human resource
            needs. Component 3: Development of MEF (Office of Economic
            Studies) and MPCE's Capacity for Strategic Monitoring
            of Sector Policy via Sector Ministries' Tracking of
            Service Delivery. The program will be implemented through
            MEF's Office of Economic Studies and represents a first
            step toward taking budgetary formulation and tracking beyond
            a financial focus to an emphasis on monitoring outcomes.
            Component 4: Anti-corruption and Civil Society Engagement:
            the projectI will help develop the anti-corruption unit
            (ULCC's) programming capacity, its skills and
            techniques for determining institutional vulnerabilities
            (corruption diagnostics) and the design of their remedies,
            and provide assistance in drafting and supervising
            implementation of improved laws (notably, a freedom of
            information law). Component 5: a Project Coordinating Unit
            (PCU) will be responsible for the implementation of IDA and
            IDB supported economic governance assistance programs and
            for coordinating with other donors.
